column1: # description: "5K Schedule 1: 30 to 40 Miles (48-63 km) per Week" from "Faster Road Racing: 5K to Half Marathon" by Pete D. Pfitzinger and Philip Latter. "This schedule is for runners who have been training 25 to 35 miles per week. If you have been running fewer than 25 miles per week
column2: you should follow the training schedule for building up to 30 miles per week outlined in chapter 8 before attempting this schedule. The schedule starts at 30 miles per week and gradually builds up to 40 miles with three weeks to go before your goal race. The training then tapers so you are fit and refreshed for race day."
6 × 12 sec uphill followed by 6 × 100 m strides
4 × 6 min LT intervals\n(jog 2 min recovery)
6 × 12 sec uphill followed by 6 × 100 m strides
5 × 3 min uphill @ 3K-5K race effort\n(jog downhill recovery)
2 sets of 3 × 300 m @ 800 m to mile race pace\n(jog 300 m recovery and 4 min between sets)
3 × 8 min LT intervals\n(jog 3 min recovery)
2 sets of 4 × 200 m @ 800 m to mile race pace\n(jog 200 m recovery and 4 min between sets)
6 × 12 sec uphill followed by 6 × 100 m strides
5 × 1,000 m @ 3K-5K race pace\n(jog 50-90% interval time recovery)
20 min tempo run

2 sets of 6 × 100 m strides\n(jog 3 min between sets)
